Package client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
client.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
Sender
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sender
The class Client represents a client model used to communicate with server

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Client​(Controller controller, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String host, int port)
    Constructs client instance with given params

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void sendAdded​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> addedFiles)
    Sends new files which appeared in the local folder to server by multiple execution of sendFile
    void sendDeleted​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> deletedFiles)
    Sends names of files to be deleted to server in the form of header=5, count of files, files' names
    void sendFile​(java.io.File file)
    Sends file to DataOutputStream in the form of header=3, file's length, file's name and file's bytes This method is threadsafe thanks to ReentrantLock set on output stream
    void sendFile​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String receiver)
    Sends file's name to be sent to another user in the form of header=7, file's name, receiver's name
    void sendGoodbye()
    Sends goodbye to server in the form of header=2
    void sendGreeting()
    Sends greeting to server in the form of header=3 and client's username

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client​(Controller controller, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String host, int port)
      Constructs client instance with given params
      Parameters:
      controller - the controller responsible for GUI
      username - the client name
      path - the path to local folder
      host - the host name
      port - the port number

  • Method Details

    • sendFile

      public void sendFile​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends file to DataOutputStream in the form of header=3, file's length, file's name and file's bytes This method is threadsafe thanks to ReentrantLock set on output stream
      Specified by:
      sendFile in interface Sender
      Parameters:
      file - the file handler
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when writing

    • sendGreeting

      public void sendGreeting()
      Sends greeting to server in the form of header=3 and client's username
      Specified by:
      sendGreeting in interface Sender

    • sendGoodbye

      public void sendGoodbye() throws java.io.IOException
      Sends goodbye to server in the form of header=2
      Specified by:
      sendGoodbye in interface Sender
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • sendDeleted

      public void sendDeleted​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> deletedFiles) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends names of files to be deleted to server in the form of header=5, count of files, files' names
      Specified by:
      sendDeleted in interface Sender
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • sendAdded

      public void sendAdded​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> addedFiles)
      Sends new files which appeared in the local folder to server by multiple execution of sendFile
      Specified by:
      sendAdded in interface Sender
      Parameters:
      addedFiles - the list of files' names to be added on server

    • sendFile

      public void sendFile​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String receiver) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends file's name to be sent to another user in the form of header=7, file's name, receiver's name
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of file to be sent
      receiver - the name of destination client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs when writing
